summary: Future-proofing sports broadcasting's most iconic program. The comprehensive Studio X refresh maintains SportsCenter's industry leadership while pioneering virtual production technology for daily broadcast operations.
challenge: ESPN sought to future-proof the studio while maintaining the show's established identity — integrating cutting-edge virtual production technology, expanding LED capabilities, and softening the existing aesthetic, all while keeping SportsCenter on-air throughout construction.
approach: Working with Jack Morton Worldwide, Mystic delivered scenic fabrication for the comprehensive second phase including curved wall treatments, wood feature wrapping around the new 'catwalk' area, pendant lighting integration, and dimensional wall effects with embedded lighting. The signature innovation — a 'depth monitor' creating a virtual fifth wall with realistic parallax using ESPN's proprietary GRACE platform.
result: The Studio X refresh launched on September 7, 2023 — ESPN's 44th anniversary — maintaining SportsCenter's position as the industry benchmark for sports news presentation. The depth monitor integration represents pioneering use of virtual production for daily programming.

testimonial.quote: To my knowledge, I don't know anybody else who's doing depth monitor all day long on their productions. So it feels pretty innovative to me, and I think that's the space we need to be in.
testimonial.author: Marti Hanzlik
